words.definition: Advice is an opinion about what to do.
words.example: I don’t know how to study. Can you give me some advice?

words.definition: Along means to move from one part of a road, river, etc. to another.
words.example: Walk along this tunnel for ten minutes, and you’ll see the door.

words.definition: Attention is the notice, thought, or consideration of someone.
words.example: His work got a lot of attention.

words.definition: To attract means to make a person or thing come closer or be interested.
words.example: The magnet attracted the metal.

words.definition: To climb means to use your hands and feet to go up on something.
words.example: The man climbed the mountain.

words.definition: To drop is to fall or allow something to fall.
words.example: A small amount of water dropped from the bottle.

words.definition: If something is final, it is the last part.
words.example: In the final part of the movie, the man finds the money.

words.definition: Further is used to say something is from a greater distance.
words.example: The road goes further than the house.

words.definition: To imply something is to suggest it without saying it directly.
words.example: The man implied that he was highly intelligent.

words.definition: To maintain means to make something continue in the same way.
words.example: The scientist maintained the same temperature in the room.

words.definition: Neither is used to say that two things or people are not V-ing.
words.example: Neither of us forgot the movie.

words.definition: Otherwise means different or in another way.
words.example: It’s good to stay active; otherwise, you’ll get fat.

words.definition: If something is physical, it is related to the body not the mind.
words.example: Biking is a physical activity.

words.definition: To prove something is to show that it is true.
words.example: My teacher proved the answer on the board.

words.definition: To react is to act in a certain way because of something that happened.
words.example: James reacted badly to the news.

words.definition: To ride something is to travel on it and control it.
words.example: I will ride a roller coaster for the first time today.

words.definition: If something is situated somewhere, it is in that place.
words.example: The whiteboard is situated between the two windows.

words.definition: Society is a group of people who live together in a community.
words.example: Society expects people to follow the law.

words.definition: A standard is what people consider normal or good.
words.example: This book is the standard for smart people.

words.definition: To suggest something means to give an idea or plan about it.
words.example: He suggested that we go to see his boss.
